div.em: Current conditions as of 19 Apr 15:50 pm CDT

div.div: Increasing clouds, with a low around 50. North northwest wind 10 to 15 mph becoming light and variable after midnight. Winds could gust as high as 20 mph.
Mostly cloudy, with a high near 77. North wind around 5 mph becoming east in the afternoon.
Partly cloudy, with a low around 55. East southeast wind 5 to 10 mph.

div.p:
Corona Virus Update 9
April 17, 2020
I continue to hope everyone is well. Stay the course and continue following the federal, state, and local guidelines. They are working.
A website link for the Texas Department of State Health services is below. It is one of several I visit daily to keep up with our current health crisis. . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Corona 9 Update

The Board of Trustees of the Olney Independent School District (the . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Order to Postpone May 2nd Election to November 3rd

div.p:
CDC now recommends you wear a mask in public where you can’t avoid being near people, like in grocery stores, pharmacies & healthcare settings https://bit.ly/2V8o5Y2 . Remember though, your local authorities may have already issued a specific order re: masks. #StayHomeTexas
CDC recomienda que use una máscara en público donde no pueda evitar estar cerca de . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Health Update For Sunday, April 12th

div.p:
The virus lives in tiny droplets in the lungs of people w/ COVID-19, even when they don’t show symptoms. We can breathe the same air as anyone within abt. 6 ft. of us. Staying farther apart from people during this time reduces the chance of breathing in the virus. #StayHomeTexas
El virus vive en gotas en los pulmones de personas con COVID-19, y a veces no tienen síntomas. Puedes respirar el . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Health Update Saturday, April 11th

div.p:
Corona Virus Update 8
April 10, 2020
I hope everyone is well. I encourage us all to continue following the federal, state, and local guidelines. They seem to be working.
Intermittently individuals have made anonymous donations to food services. A HUGE THANKS!! We are distributing between 250 and 300 meals per day. Watch for updates to delivery schedules and . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Corona Virus Update 8

div.p:
Coughing & sneezing can send tiny infected droplets into the air which can be inhaled by anyone within 6 feet of us. Always cough or sneeze into a tissue or your elbow and immediately wash your hands to lessen the risk of spreading the virus. Be smart. Stay well! #StayHomeTexas
Toser y estornudar puede llevar gotas infectadas al aire, que pueden ser inhaladas por personas que estén a 6 pies de . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Health Update Friday, April 10th

div.p:
People with no symptoms have the potential to unknowingly spread COVID-19! That’s why it’s best for everyone in your family to stay at home and away from others as much as possible until instructed otherwise from state and local officials. #StayHomeTexas
¡Las personas sin síntomas tienen el potencial de propagar COVID-19 sin saberlo! Por eso lo mejor para todos en su familia es . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about TEA Health Update Wednesday, April 9th

div.p:
By staying apart for the time being, DISTRICT is working to ensure that we are limiting the spread of COVID-19 in our community. In service of this, I want to share a one-minute video that reminds us of the most important actions we can take as individuals to reduce risk for ourselves and others:
Practice social distancing Wash your hands Stay home as much as . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Hands Up & Stay At Home

div.p:
Texas, remember the importance of social distancing. If you must go out, avoid public spaces and keep your distance from others (at least 6 feet). If we continue to follow valuable public health guidance, fewer of our friends & family will be affected by COVID-19. #StayHomeTexas
Texas, recuerda la importancia del distanciamiento social. Evite espacios públicos y manténgase . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about TEA Update for April 8th

div.p:
English
#COVID19 lives on droplets in the lungs of people with the virus, even if they don’t have symptoms. When infected people breathe, the virus enters the air. If you can’t #StayHome, wear a mask/scarf/bandana, stay 6 feet apart, and wash your hands. #DontGoViral
Spanish:
#COVID19 vive de gotas en los pulmones de las personas con el virus incluso si no . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about TEA Update April 7th
